title: L.A.'s winter homeless shelter gets an upgrade: motel vouchers
dc:creator: Doug Smith
description: The Los Angeles winter shelter program opened Nov. 1 with fewer than half as many locations but a new plan to offer motel vouchers on the most inclement nights.
content:encoded: The Los Angeles winter shelter program opened Nov. 1 with fewer than half as many locations but a new plan to offer motel vouchers on the most inclement nights.

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA - MARCH 22, 2018 - Rose Rios, 70, from Cover the Homeless Ministry, right, helps a sickly Aldora Smith, 65, back to her van after the Homeless Outreach Program Intergrated Care System needed more time to access Smith's situation in South Los Angeles on March 22, 2018. She was being sent back to her rain soaked tent in an alley. Rios took her back to the alley to collect her medicine and some clothes. She then took Aldora and her boyfriend to the winter shelter at Bethal Church at 7900 Western Avenue in South Los Angeles. (Genaro Molina / Los Angeles Times)
